question_text: During network troubleshooting, a technician finds inconsistent signal loss across multiple terminals on a punchdown block. What is the MOST likely cause?
answer_options: The punchdown block lacks surge protection
The technician used a crimping tool instead of a punchdown tool
The wiring standard used was for fiber optics
The block was improperly grounded to a metal frame
correct_answer: The technician used a crimping tool instead of a punchdown tool
explanation: Using the wrong tool (e.g., crimping instead of punching) can lead to poor contact and unreliable terminations.
